platforms.name: Code Llama
platforms.description: Code Llama is a family of large language models (LLMs) specifically fine-tuned from Meta's LLaMA 2 for programming and code-related tasks. It excels at generating, explaining, debugging, and completing code across a wide range of popular languages like Python, C++, Java, and JavaScript. It is uniquely positioned as a state-of-the-art, open-source alternative to proprietary code models, offering specialized variants for infilling and long-context support.
keyFeatures: Code generation from natural language prompts
Code infilling within existing code context
Support for over 20 programming languages (Python, C++, Java, Bash, etc.)

platforms.name: Phind CodeLlama
platforms.description: Phind CodeLlama is a fine-tuned version of Meta's Code Llama 34B model, specifically optimized for programming assistance and code generation. It excels at understanding complex technical questions, generating syntactically correct code across multiple languages, and providing detailed explanations for developers. What makes it unique is its focus on high-quality, production-ready code output and its enhanced reasoning capabilities for solving intricate programming challenges, setting it apart from more general-purpose coding assistants.
keyFeatures: Code generation in 80+ programming languages
Context window of 16,384 tokens for handling large codebases
Optimized for zero-shot programming question answering

platforms.name: WizardCoder
platforms.description: WizardCoder is an open-source code generation model that leverages the Evol-Instruct methodology to produce high-quality, instruction-following code across multiple programming languages. It is specifically designed to understand complex programming tasks and generate syntactically correct, functional code snippets, making it a powerful tool for developers. Its uniqueness lies in its training process, which uses iterative evolution of instructions to significantly improve performance on coding benchmarks, often outperforming larger models.
keyFeatures: Evol-Instruct fine-tuning on the CodeAlpaca dataset
Support for multiple programming languages (Python, Java, JavaScript, C++, etc.)
Available in multiple model sizes (e.g., 1B, 3B, 7B, 13B, 15B, 34B parameters)

platforms.name: Continue AI
platforms.description: Continue is an open-source AI coding assistant that integrates directly into VS Code and JetBrains IDEs. Its key capability is running powerful language models (like GPT-4, Claude, or local LLMs) locally on your machine, enabling full offline operation, unparalleled data privacy, and deep editor integration for code completion, refactoring, and chat. It uniquely targets developers and enterprises who prioritize security, control over their data, and the flexibility to customize their AI workflow without relying on cloud APIs.
keyFeatures: Local Model Execution: Run models like Llama 2, CodeLlama, or Mistral directly on your machine with Ollama, LM Studio, or Replicate.
Deep IDE Integration: Seamless inline code completion, edit commands, and chat within VS Code and JetBrains IDEs (IntelliJ, PyCharm, etc.).
Open-Source Core & Extensible: Fully open-source (Apache 2.0) with a modular architecture for adding custom models, context providers, and slash commands.

platforms.name: Continue
platforms.description: Continue is an open-source AI coding assistant that integrates directly into VS Code as an extension, providing context-aware code completion, editing, and debugging assistance. It uniquely prioritizes developer privacy and control by running AI models locally by default, ensuring code never leaves the machine unless explicitly configured. Its extensible architecture allows developers to easily connect it to various local and cloud-based LLMs, making it a flexible tool for security-conscious programmers and teams.
keyFeatures: VS Code extension with sidebar chat and inline code completion
Local model execution (e.g., Ollama, LM Studio) for full privacy
Configurable connections to cloud LLMs (OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini, etc.)

platforms.name: Continue IDE
platforms.description: Continue is an open-source, AI-powered coding assistant that integrates directly into VS Code and JetBrains IDEs. It provides advanced, project-aware code completions, debugging assistance, and refactoring suggestions by learning from your entire codebase context. Its unique value lies in being a local-first, extensible agent that can run multiple LLMs (including local models) and allows developers to customize their own AI workflows without sending code to external servers.
keyFeatures: Project-aware code completions using context from open files and the entire codebase
Built-in support for multiple LLMs (OpenAI, Anthropic, Ollama/Local, Gemini, etc.)
Customizable slash commands (e.g., /edit, /test, /comment) for AI-driven workflows

platforms.name: Continue.dev
platforms.description: Continue.dev is an open-source, AI-powered coding assistant that integrates directly into your IDE as an extension. It provides context-aware code completions, refactoring suggestions, and documentation generation by deeply understanding your entire codebase, including open files, terminal output, and GitHub issues. It uniquely allows developers to use their own API keys for various LLMs (like OpenAI, Anthropic, or local models) and is designed to be highly extensible and privacy-focused, running entirely on your machine.
keyFeatures: Context-aware code completion using project-wide understanding (open files, terminal, git diff)
Inline chat for asking questions and generating code based on current file context
Support for multiple LLM backends (OpenAI GPT, Anthropic Claude, Gemini, Ollama for local models)
